title: Business Development Manager
content:
Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is a world-famous brand with offices across the globe. Within Fender Musical Instruments Corporation’s ("FMIC") Australia team, we are looking for an enthusiastic Business Development Manager to join our closely-knit team who will represent the complete portfolio of Fender brands and drive business developments through.
An American icon, Fender was born in Southern California and has built a worldwide influence extending beyond the studio and the stage. A Fender is more than an instrument, it’s a cultural symbol that resonates globally.
About the role

The BDM role is to be the face of Fender in the field and to ensure that the whole of the catalog is represented by the dealers in your territory. Monthly, quarterly and annual sales budgets are achieved through daily monitoring as well as by providing business development advice to the dealers, actively encouraging the utilization of FMIC assets to promote effective New Product Introductions (NPI), staff training via Fender Academy, adherence to product ranging displays and programs and the solicitation of forward and current orders.
The primary responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:

Represent the complete portfolio of Fender brands
Drive business development through:
Regular analysis of dealer performance by Product Line (PL) and results feedback of results and opportunities to dealers
100% adoption of NPI
Utilization of FMIC assets at Core dealers (currently top 40)
Staff training via Fender Academy (and others) at CORE dealers 
Regular dealer visits in line with dealer ranking
Regular reporting and competitor activity updates
Ensure FMA business strategies are implemented, and objectives are achieved
Dealer ranging commitments are maintained
Contribute to the evaluation and development of distribution channels in conjunction with General Manager and Sales Director.
Present products and target customers to Dealers. 
Merchandising
Assist with FMA shows
Contribute to SIOP process.
Contribute to suggested updates to dealer stocking requirements and trading terms
Contribute to product segmentation decisions
CRM updates as required
Knowledge of MI retail and wholesale is a big plus.
Other duties and work as required

What you need: 

Computer literate with good knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of products
Three years’ experience in a Business Development/sales position
Ability to manage multiple priorities and adapt to changing work conditions, often with little to no lead time
Ability to pay close attention to detail
Ability to present to multiple audiences, through a variety of methods
Results focused
Knowledge of MI retail and wholesale is a big plus.
Report writing skills.
Experience with SAP a huge plus

Essential Competencies: 

Energetic, and positive personality and a keen interest in learning new things 
Self-motivated and self-sufficient with strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills 
Excellent spoken and written communication skills 
Hardworking, persistent, and dependable. 
Ability to problem solve, and escalate if necessary
Strong relationship building and management skills

Desirable Competencies: 

Passion for the brands and products
An interest in contemporary music and instruments.
Thorough knowledge of guitars, amps and effects processors
Knowledge of PA systems and recording

questions.label: Are you legally authorized to work in the country you are applying?
Do you speak Italian and/or French?
Please indicate what base annual salary you are seeking? (£ Numerical entry please)
Will you now or in the future require immigration sponsorship for employment visa status?
When are you available to start?

values.label: I can start this position ASAP!
My current employer requires a two week notice.
More than a two week notice will be needed.

questions.label: How did you hear about us?
If Referral or Other please specify:
Do you play a musical instrument? If yes, what instrument do you play?

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING STATEMENTS CAREFULLY: The information I've provided on this application is accurate to the best of my knowledge and subject to verification. Any misrepresentation or deliberate omission of fact in my application will be justification for refusal to employ me or for termination of my employment by Fender Musical Instruments Corporation. If employed, I shall sign the non-compete/confidentiality agreement, if applicable, in which I will agree to protect Fender Musical Instruments Corporation's confidential information. If employed, I understand that Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is an "at will" employer, in that employment is terminable at the will of the company or me at any time, with or without notice, and for any lawful reason, or no reason. I understand that, if employed, I must at all times comply with Fender Musical Instruments Corporation's standards of work performance and business conduct. Failure to do so can result in my release without notice or severance pay. I authorize Fender Musical Instruments Corporation to obtain information about me from my previous employers and schools.

values.label: I confirm I have read, understand, and agree to the statement above.
